meanings.definition: To surpass in feeling or emotion.
meanings.sent1: She always outfeels her friends when watching sad movies.
meanings.sent2: He outfeels everyone in the room when it comes to expressing joy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to outfeel the kitten in their playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outfeels the sound of a thousand bells ringing.
meanings.sent5: The sunset's beauty outfeels any painting I've ever seen.

meanings.definition: The act of feeling more intensely than others.
meanings.sent1: His outfeeling of happiness was contagious to everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The singer's outfeeling of sadness resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's outfeeling of excitement over the balloon was adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her outfeeling of fear was like a storm raging inside her heart.
meanings.sent5: The actor's outfeeling of anger was so convincing, it sent chills down my spine.
